findings.reasoning: This finding identifies a real vulnerability (infinite loop in swap function) that is not part of the ground truth. The attack scenario is concrete and would cause a denial of service. While not the TARGET vulnerability, it is a valid security issue.

This finding identifies a real vulnerability (missing token transfers in addLiquidity) that is not part of the ground truth. The attack scenario is concrete and would allow unauthorized liquidity manipulation. While not the TARGET vulnerability, it is a valid security issue.

This finding is about integer overflow/truncation in addLiquidity, but the root cause and location do not match the ground truth. The ground truth focuses on arithmetic errors in liquidity calculations during tick transitions in swap and _addLiquidity functions, specifically precision loss and overflow/underflow in _addLiquidity(). This finding is about a different issue (truncation in casting) in a different context (addLiquidity vs swap).

notes: None of the findings matched the TARGET vulnerability (arithmetic errors in swap/_addLiquidity during tick transitions). The LLM's findings were either about different vulnerabilities (BONUS_VALID) or did not match the root cause/location of the TARGET vulnerability (WRONG_ROOT_CAUSE). The TARGET vulnerability was not detected.
